titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Donald S. Rothchild papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by David Jacobs

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-11-17T13:50-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The Donald Rothchild papers consist of writings, research materials, and printed matter, all of which relate to Rothchild’s lengthy career as a political scientist. A specialist in the study of modern African politics and society, Rothchild had a particular interest in civil conflict and ethnic relations in post-independence African states and his research interests are reflected in the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p:
Collection is open for research.
The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Donald S. Rothchild papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2003.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Donald Rothchild papers consist of writings, research materials, and printed matter, all of which relate to Rothchild’s lengthy career as a political scientist. A specialist in the study of modern African politics and society, Rothchild had a particular interest in civil conflict and ethnic relations in post-independence African states and his research interests are reflected in the collection. In addition to writing about the consequences of civil wars in Africa, Rothchild wrote about developments in Ghana, Nigeria, and Kenya. The research materials in the papers parallel Rothchild’s writings, but also include other topics. There are extensive materials relating to the Biafran conflict in Nigeria in the late 1960s and the realization of independence for Zimbabwe. There are also materials relating to Rothchild’s interest in comparative history. These include documents pertaining to conflicts in Northern Ireland and the former Yugoslavia, both of which Rothchild thought could be compared with the history of civil wars in Africa. There are also materials relating to American foreign policy in relation to Africa. The printed matter in the collection is largely comprised of government reports on economic and social matters. There are also a number of pamphlets containing analyses of political developments in various African states. The printed matter is listed by country and date in the finding aid.

did.unittitle: "From Federalism to Neo-Federalism in East Africa"
"African Federations and the Diplomacy of Decolonization"
"Integrations by Prolonged Negotiation: The Treaty fo East African Co-operation"
"From Hegemony to Bargaining in East African Relations"
"Ethnicity, Conflict Avoidance, and the Ghana Military"
"Comparative Public Demand and Expectation Patterns in Ghana"
"Military Regime Performance: An Appraisal of the Ghana Experience, 1972-1978," Comparative Politics
With E. Gyimah-Boadi, "Ghana's Economic Decline and Development Strategies" (book chapter)
"The Rawlings Revolution in Ghana: Pragmatism with Populist Rhetoric"
With Robert L. Curry, Jr., "Basic Human Needs: The Development of a Development Strategy"
With Timothy Sisk, "The Role of Peacekeeping in African Transitions: April 1990 to March 1992"
"Structuring State-Society Relations in African States: Toward an Enabling Political Environment"
With Stephen John Stedman, "Peace Operations: From Short-Term to Long-Term Commitment," paper, International Studies Association Annual Meetings, San Diego, California
"Ethnic Fears, Security Dilemmas, and Conflict Management in Africa"
"Conflict Management and Elite Habituation in Post-War Democracy: The Case of Mozambique"
"Selective Safety Nets: America's Cautious Engagement with African Peackeeping and Its Consequences," paper, Annual Meeting of the African Studies Association, Chicago, Illinois
Review of Herbst, Jeffrey, States and Power in Africa: Comparative Lessons in Authority and Control
"The Effects of State Crisis on African Interstate Relations (and Comparisons with Post-Soviet Eurasia)"
With Nikolas Emmanuel, "U.S. Public Opinion and Intervention in Africa's Ethnic Conflicts," paper, Annual Meeting of the International Studies Association, Portland, Oregon
"Reconstituting the African State after Civil War"
"Reassuring Weaker Parties after Civil Wars: The Benefits and Costs of Executive Power-sharing Systems in Africa," Ethnopolitics, Vol. 4, No. 3
